text: the state alleged they hacked sabata petros chale thirty-nine to death in marikana west on december eight two thousand and sixteen allegedly over the allocation of low cost rdp houses at marikana west extension two
chale was allegedly chased by group of about thirty people and was hacked to death with pangas axes and spears
the farmworkers strike resumed on tuesday when their demands were not met

demonstrators have filed for permit to hold rally on saturday in yuen long the district on the outskirts of hong kong where dozens of masked men chased and beat commuters and protesters with wooden poles and metal rods leaving at least forty-five people in hospital

footage of the attack which included pregnant woman being hit protesters being punched and kneed and commuters screaming and crying while trying to shield themselves emerged on sunday night fuelling further political unrest as demonstrators opposition lawmakers and others demanded answers from authorities for failing to stop the violence

max chung who delivered the application for letter of no objection from the police that is required to hold rally said we want to show to the public and international community that hong kongers we will never surrender in front of terrorism to show our solidarity and say no to terrorism we have to stand up chung said yuen long was under terrorist attack and we have no choice but to take it back the protests principally over controversial bill that would allow suspects to be extradited from hong kong to mainland china have taken on new demands including an investigation into police use of rubber bullets teargas and physical violence against protesters
protesters are angry at the police slow response to the attack in yuen long and their pursuit of the case
the violence in yuen long has heightened tensions and fears of further attacks
on tuesday evening unverified footage showed men in white gathering in tuen mun another city near yuen long in the new territories

hong kong leader carrie lam said the shocking violence in yuen long would be investigated but devoted most of her comments to criticising protesters who surrounded beijing liaison office in hong kong and defaced the national emblem of the people republic of china on sunday
on tuesday group of aviation staff called for protest at hong kong airport on friday to condemn the government and police for ignoring the random attacks on citizens in yuen long
in yuen long chung and other protesters are demanding the government conducts an independent investigation and officially characterises the violence as crossborder terrorist attack

hailey leung university student who has been attending the protests this summer said the fear of the gangs is definitely stronger than the fear of the use of violence of the police her parents have been supportive of the protests but since the violence in yuen long they have asked her not to attend
nhai case cops fail to produce accused in court

10th september two thousand and fifteen am kochi anoop george the main accused in the case related to attack on the office of the national highway authority of india nhai at kalamassery could not be produced before the ernakulam district and principal sessions court on wednesday after jail authorities in coimbatore failed to arrange escort for him
suddenly motley group of sloganshouting students emerged from the dhaba
they exhorted us to join the protest against the recommendations of the mandal commission which had been implemented day earlier
thus we too joined the sloganeering

by the time the selfstyled leaders had commandeered few dtc buses nearly two hundred postgraduate and doctoral students had gathered at an intersection which later became the epicentre of protests and was rechristened euphemistically as kranti chowk
some hotheads tried to gatecrash provoking the policemen into action they charged ferociously dispersing the crowd within minutes
that night doordarshan telecast news of protests

jammu delhi court blast accused killed in kishtwar august seven two thousand and twelve ist two thousand and eleven delhi high court blast accused amir ali kamal was among two hizb ul mujahideen hm militants killed on monday in shootout with security forces in the mountainous kishtwar district of jammu and kashmir police said
as we closed in on the hideout of the militants fire fight began that continued for over an hour he said
according to reports two militants have been shot dead in the encounter
one of them is amir ali kamal code name akram who was prime accused in the delhi high court blast the officer said
it was in january this year group of persons attacked the nhai office at kalamassery and distributed notices supporting armed revolt against the government
akram was on the radar of the national investigation agency nia as he is believed to have arranged explosives and planter for the blast
he is an accused in the delhi high court blast of sep seven two thousand and eleven in which at least ten people were killed and over seventy injured
the nia wanted to catch akram alive as he could provide clues in resolving the blast case
the kishtwar area has been in focus ever since the delhi high court blast as the first of the mails claiming responsibility for the blast emanated from here
two more youths were arrested later for allegedly being involved in the blast
modi visited the homes of all the six victims of the serial blasts which rocked patna gandhi maidan and other parts of the city during his visit to address the hunkar rally on october twenty-seven

namo who had avoided visiting the victims of the two thousand and two riots in his own state for long time lost no time in burning up aviation fuel by dashing to patna twice in one week to express condolences and score points over his rambunctious rivals
now he is charged with exploiting the grief of the terror victims of two thousand six hundred and ten
by visiting the families of the patna blast victims namo is drilling home the point that niku is least bothered about the personal tragedies of his people
in august that year militantly aggressive kurmis mowed down fourteen dalits in the sleepy hamlet of belchchi in nalanda district
both anoop and ramanan are also accused in the case related to attack on the nitta gelatin office at panampilly nagar last year
indira landed in nalanda and waded into the floodwaters on an elephant to visit each dalit family which had lost members in the caste pogrom
the grief list also includes the nights spent by rahul in dalit colonies and the visits of manmohan singh and sonia gandhi to chhattisgarh after top congress leaders were massacred by naxalites
modiites are now reminding the congress about the trips which sonia and the prime minister made to muzzafarnagar after forty-three were killed in the worstever communal clashes in decades
bandhopadhay also said two trinamool congress workers were killed at sashan in north twenty-four parganas district recently
car with union ministers mukul roy and sultan ahmed was attacked allegedly by cpm cadres on wednesday he alleged

december five two thousand and seventeen ist say officials at the panchayat level are colluding with locals residents of varavani panchayat staged protest at the collectorate here on monday against illegal tapping of drinking water supplied through pipelines under the cauvery combined water supply scheme and irregular supply of water to their villages
ramanathapuram residents protest against illegal water connections

led by sagayamadha an officebearer of the all india farm workers association the villagers including large number of women from the panchayat comprising six villages staged the protest urging the district administration to immediately disconnect the illegal water connections and ensure uninterrupted water supply to them

us committed to seeking justice on behalf of all two thousand six hundred and eleven victims fifth august two thousand and fifteen pm new york the us is committed to pursuing justice on behalf of the victims of the two thousand and eight mumbai attack no matter how arduous the task is top indianorigin american diplomat has said

we have certainly reiterated our support and our commitment to india efforts to seek justice on behalf of the victims of the two thousand six hundred and eleven attack assistant secretary of state for south and central asian affairs nisha desai biswal told pti when asked about the delay in bringing to justice the perpetrators of the two thousand and eight terror attacks

biswal who had travelled to the city from washington to speak at the indian consulate general mediaindia lecture series yesterday said not only were there large number of indian victims in the attack but there were americans also who lost their lives
vs condemns attack on nss karayogams eighth may two thousand and eleven am thiruvananthapuram chief minister achuthanandan has condemned the recent attacks on nss karayogams

given that nearly seven years have passed since the horrendous terror attacks that claimed over one hundred and sixty lives and injured many others biswal said bringing justice for the victims in terror attacks may appear to be an arduous andlongdrawn process
biswal underlined that the us on its part had offered rewards for information leading to the arrest and prosecution of individuals associated with the mumbai attack
referring to the terror attack in punjab gurdaspur district on july twenty-seven biswal said the us has strongly condemned and expressed its concern over the attack
she said the us has expressed its cooperation ith indian authorities on on any specific aspects of the incident

on media reports that the night vision device used by three terrorists in the gurdaspur attack had us markings biswal said the us is in conversation with indian authorities to try to ascertain and trace the origins of the equipment found

we will continue to work very closely with the indian government on those issues she said adding that it is an ongoing process and the us is working with indian authorities to address issues of concern emanating from the incident

the step came after rld workers led by district party president ajit rathi former up minister dharamvir balyan and mlc chaudhry mushtaq staged dharna outside the dm office here yesterday and submitted memorandum to him

chennai chennai sees its first ever hunger fast against hcl april eight two thousand and thirteen ist for the first time in chennai graduates denied jobs by multinational corporation who had recruited them from their college campuses staged hunger strike on sunday

as many as fifty-nine recruits who had graduated from different colleges of the state came together for the fourth time to demand answers from hcl technologies the company that had recruited them in two thousand and eleven
the recruits at valluvar kottam shouted slogans including hcl lend us your ears give us back our two years while undertaking the daylong fast
when asked about the series of attacks on karayogams he said that such attacks could not be entertained

three arrested in bimbola clash eighteenth june two thousand and fourteen am dhenkanal three persons were arrested on tuesday for their alleged involvement in killing of naib sarpanch in clash between members of two communities at bimbola village under dhenkanal sadar police limits on monday
the naib sarpanch was killed and seventeen others were seriously injured in the clash over use of village field
bimbola village turned into battle field as rival groups wielding guns took the centre stage
the clash took place over use of the field
police said he was detained by group of thirty to forty persons from the general caste on monday morning but he managed to escape
however when he was returning home in the night pradhan was intercepted again by them and killed
soon clash ensued between supporters of pradhan and the rival group in which seventeen persons were injured

ishrat jahan nineteen yearold college student was killed along with three others on june fifteen two thousand and four allegedly by team of crime branch officials on the outskirts of ahmedabad after intelligence inputs that group of lashkar terrorists have plotted to kill gujarat chief minister narendra modi to avenge the two thousand and two communal riots in the state

thirteen sep two thousand and fourteen three people were sentenced to death by yunnan court for their role in the attack at kunming rail station that killed thirty-one people and injured one hundred and forty-one in march

kunming railway station attack three given death penalty over kunming rail station attack influenced by religious extremism trio plotted knife rampage court says while fourth defendant handed life sentence for taking part
published friday twelve september two thousand and fourteen pm xi jinping urges china central asian neighbours to help step up extremism fight
patigul tohti who was wounded and captured at the scene was jailed for life after being convicted of taking part in the attack

the nss karayogams were attacked in thrissur and thiruvananthapuram after nss secretary sukumaran nair had said that the nss did not support the ldf in the recent assembly elections as it did not want achuthanandan to come back to power for another term
tohtunyaz helped them to acquire more than ten knives used in the attack
two days before the attack local police arrested tohtunyaz ehet and muhammad as they tried to illegally cross into vietnam via honghe county the court said
they did not confess to the planned attack after their capture and so should bear full responsibility for the loss of life the court said
despite losing contact with the three men five other members of the group went ahead with the attack
initial reports by variety of media some quoting witnesses said eight people brandished knives in the saturday march one attack
police announced on the monday after the attack that three suspects had been taken into custody which now appears to be reference to the trio detained on february twenty-seven
at least five more people will be tried over the attack xinhua has reported
the government has blamed separatist forces from xinjiang for the attack
mainland authorities have launched massive crackdown against terrorism in wake of string of violent attacks in the restive xinjiang region and other cities on the mainland

the pair oaths are invalid and they will not be able to retake them china rubberstamp legislature said one day after thousands marched through the streets of hong kong to protest against beijing interference
during chaotic swearingin ceremony last month yau and leung thumbed their noses at beijing by refusing to declare their allegiance to china and carrying blue flags reading hong kong is not china
the attack on karayogams had sparked sharp reactions from the cpm leaders

but many in hong kong complain those freedoms have been eroded in recent years leading to nearly three months of street protests in two thousand and fourteen known as the umbrella revolution and to the election in september this year of six politicians pushing for greater autonomy for the city
about thirteen thousand marched on sunday to protest against china intervention ending in clashes with police outside beijing main presence in the city and four arrests
some schools which had to postpone their midterm examinations due to the bandh have the additional task of conducting the tests before resuming the classes
yes he the fellow who assured his government bosses the july one two thousand and three protest march would draw mere thousands not the half million that actually turned up

taxi strike impacts businesses in soshanguve brenda masilela pretoria november eight ana employees at the soshanguve plaza south of pretoria arrived for work on wednesday only to find businesses closed amid fears that the taxi strike might turn violent

27th february two thousand and nine am colombo india on thursday told pakistan that it recognised what islamabad had done so far to investigate the involvement of pakistanis in the mumbai attacks and curb crossborder terrorism but lot more remained to be done to ensure that such attacks did not recur
lot more to be done india tells pakistan

foreign secretary shivshankar menon who discussed bilateral issues with his pakistani counterpart salman bashir on the sidelines of the saarc foreign secretaries meeting here said that islamabad would have to bring the perpetrators of the mumbai attack to justice and give credible evidence of dismantling the terrorist infrastructure on the soil of pakistan
about one hundred and twenty-five bus operators across gauteng stopped reporting for duty two weeks ago following dispute in mileage payment
over sixty thousand pupils were left stranded by the strike

flash strike by guards delays suburban trains indian express express news service express news service fri nov thirty two thousand and twelve hrs most guards on local trains abstained from work thursday protesting irritable behaviour of the area officer at churchgate forcing station masters and traffic inspectors to take up their role
am going to argue your evidence that strikers at marikana in august two thousand and twelve attacked the police should be kicked out
four days ago guard rakesh jha had gone on hunger strike at churchgate station after he was denied leave despite applying two months back
guard said when jha did not get leave till four hours before departure of his train he hanged poster around his neck announcing an indefinite hunger strike
all the four hundred and seventeen guards in the suburban section refused to work extra hours in protest
the left have been wiped out gandhi said at rally here
there is anarchy everywhere misrule is all pervasive and there is conspiracy of corruption she told the gathering of about thirty thousand people

she did not directly name bhattaparsaul the twin villages that have emerged as the epicentre of the agitation against land acquisition by the uttar pradesh government for an expressway project but specifically mentioned the atrocities on farmers
her son and congress general secretary rahul gandhi has taken up the issue in big way staging daylong sitin at the village after four people including two police personnel were killed in clashes
scores of students teachers and women rights organisations had yesterday staged protest outside college demanding thampu resignation for shielding the accused

protests in kupwara molestation of girl over indian express agencies agencies srinagar thu jul nine two thousand and nine hrs locals took to the streets in frontier district of kupwara today demanding the arrest of territorial army jawan who allegedly tried to molest young woman following which she committed suicide
after family members narrated the incident to their neighbours people came on the road and held demonstrations

mpofu said ltcol kaizer modiba was fabricating his evidence about the violence during the mineworkers strike at marikana near rustenburg in the north west because he had not been in position to witness an attack

tiruvannamalai cab drivers owners take out rally may twenty-two two thousand and twelve ist tourist cab drivers and owners took out rally here on monday demanding to scrap lifetime tax system introduced by tamil nadu government
the rally started from kamaraj statue and proceeded through important roads of the town before culminating in front of revenue divisional office
tiruvannamalai district tourist car van dirversowners welfare association that organised the rally insisted that old tax system should continue
at the end of the rally they submitted memorandum to revenue divisional officer bupathi

three cong workers killed on phaseiv eve indian express kolkata mon jul twenty-two two thousand and thirteen hrs on the eve of the fourth phase of panchayat elections widespread incidents of violence led to the death of three congress workers on sunday
police said two congress workers nurmohhamad sheikh and ahad ali were killed after being hit by crude bombs late saturday night at kapasdanga in murshidabad district
tmc workers have been accused of leading the attacks
there were reports of skirmishes and clashes including stone pelting in the area in which two policemen were injured
another congress worker repon sheikh was killed at bharatpur in the same district during clash between rival party supporters the police said
speaking to tv news channel chief minister mamata banerjee shrugged off the allegations that trinamool cadres were behind the killing of the congress workers
his attackers allegedly drank his blood
observed the attack on the police have no doubt about it modiba said during crossexamination
accusing the cpm of instigating the violence she said the deaths were result of clashes between the congress and the marxists
but congress mp and union minister from murshidabad adhir chowdhury blamed the trinamool for the violence
he alleged that the police did act to prevent such incidents despite the party giving them inputs about the violence beforehand
the miscreants who were earlier with the cpm and have recently joined the tmc are responsible for the violence chowdhury said
beijing launched campaign to educate tibetan monks and nuns after unrest rocked tibetanpopulated areas in march two thousand and eight
the taxi strike that left commuters stranded in johannesburg was expected to also disrupt matric pupils writing exams on monday the gauteng education department said
we have been told of possible oneday strike that has already affected soweto
earlier the johannesburg metro police said the strike was expected to also disrupt the reya vaya bus service
it was not immediately clear what triggered the strike
the sa national taxi council said it did not call for the strike
he said he was about one hundred metres away when he witnessed the attack
we do not know about the strike if we called for strike we could have informed commuters said president philip taaibosch

sena legislators protest against yedyurappa first april two thousand and ten pm mumbai shiv sena workers including some legislators today staged demonstrations against karnataka chief minister yeddyurappa here protesting the forcible installation of kannadiga mayor in marathidominated belgaum city
the sena members staged protest at gateway of india adjacent to taj hotel where the karnataka cm was put up
the protesters shouted slogans against the karnataka cm demanding that belgaum along with marathi speaking areas in that state be merged with maharashtra

yesterday over fifty karnataka rakshana vedike krv activists were taken into custody when they allegedly tried to attack some members of maharashtra ekikaran samithi mes and corporators of belgaum city corporation
thousands of demonstrators marched in hong kong on saturday facing the threat of arrest and increasingly severe warnings from beijing
protesters clad head to toe in black carrying umbrellas and orange helmets deviated from the route approved by police and took over major road of the normally busy shopping district of mongkok
one group held black banner with the words the police have overstepped while others chanted for the release of protesters who have been arrested over the last two months of demonstrations
protesters distributed protective gear such as face masks in the event of clashes with police who have used teargas on demonstrators
the previously banned march was sanctioned by the police at the last minute and is one of several protests this weekend in hong kong
modiba said he saw the aggressive strikers running alongside police nyala charging at police
as the city enters its ninth consecutive week of protests the movement shows few signs of abating as public anger at the government spreads to more parts of hong kong society
thousands of civil servants medical workers and staff from the city finance sector rallied on thursday and friday while further protests were planned through the weekend

the protests which began over proposal to allow extradition to china pose the most serious challenge to china authority over the city since one thousand nine hundred and ninety-seven when it was returned from british to chinese control
in recent days beijing has ramped up its condemnation of the protests which it describes as riots and has accused the us and other western powers of instigating the unrest to hurt china

on thursday chen daoxiang the head of the chinese army garrison in hong kong said the military was determined to protect the national sovereignty of hong kong and would help put down the intolerable unrest if requested
hong kong police on thursday also charged forty-four people linked to the protests with rioting crime that carries maximum penalty of ten years in prison
on online forums there were claims that police decided to allow the previously banned protest in mongkok in order to surround demonstrators and arrest them en masse
if peaceful marches that disrupt the road for an afternoon or so don work maybe it spills over to blockading more roads maybe for long
the statement condemned authorities for turning deaf ear to peaceful protests from wide section society and threatened more actions

an integrated steel plant agriculture and mineralbased industries should be set up in kadapa district for ensuring its comprehensive development and generate employment cpi district secretary narayana demanded while addressing party functionaries who staged dharna in front of kadapa collectorate on thursday

the commission chaired by retired judge ian farlam is investigating the deaths of forty-four people during the wagerelated strike at lonmin platinum mining operations at marikana in august two thousand and twelve

andhra pradesh work in banks insurance firms hit august twenty-one two thousand and eight ist back to old days horsedrawn cart comes in handy for passengers as autos went off the road during the general strike in kurnool on wednesday
cmp tirupati the allindia general strike called by trade unions on wednesday badly hit the working of the psu banks lic and the general insurance companies in chittoor district
photo credit photo you subramanyam trade unions oppose move to introduce comprehensive insurance bill
upa failure to contain price line criticised centre states accused of sidelining

besides the bank and the insurance company employees medical and sales representatives members of the utf anganwadi municipal and construction workers hamalis including the rtc porters participated in the rally taken out under the banner of the leftist unions protesting against the antiemployee and antinational policies of the congressled upa government
upa criticised demonstrations were held in front of the bank branches and the insurance company premises denouncing the failure of the upa government in holding the price line

leaders of the cpim cpi tdp and the frontal units addressing the rally lashed out at the central and state governments for doing nothing except chanting indira rajiv and sonia mantra grossly sideling the national common minimum programme

secretary of the insurance corporation employees union nellore division gopalakrishnaiah and other leaders who held demonstration in front of the united india insurance company here criticised the upa that had categorically said it would strengthen the lic and gics but was doing just the opposite by hiking the cap on the foreign direct investment in the insurance sector
kurnool work in all offices and financial institutions came to stand still on account of the strike
the members of aituc citu cpi cpi ngos bank and insurance employees unions took out rally

seven maoists killed in gun battle eighteenth february two thousand and fourteen am seven maoists were killed in twohour long gun battle with maharashtra police on the border the state shares with chhattisgarh top official said tuesday
the gun battle took place in the deep forests of bedhkati area near the gadchiroligondia border around one thousand one hundred and thirty late monday said gadchiroli superintendent of police haque
on august sixteen two thousand and twelve thirty-four people mostly mineworkers were shot dead in clash with police who were trying to disarm and disperse them
the crossfiring lasted for nearly two hours
several hundred people who have occupied homes at delft on the cape flats are on their way to the cape high court in bid to block their impending eviction spokesman said

speaking just after 1pm poni said he and the hundreds of residents who had demonstrated outside the court were now on their way by train to the high court where they would make another attempt to get an urgent interdict

police clueless about fifteen abducted by maoists fourth november two thousand and eleven pm patna four days after armed maoists abducted fifteen people including twelve labourers in bihar jamui district police are still in dark about their whereabouts and have failed to rescue them officials here said friday
police have failed to recover the fifteen abducted people
additional director general of police hqs ravinder kumar said that the state police along with central paramilitary forces have been working to rescue the abducted people
search is on to trace and recover the abducted people he said

the incident took place early tuesday at balthara village in jamui district about two hundred km from patna when over three dozen armed maoists stormed the office of private construction company engaged in bridge construction and abducted the fifteen people
police suspect that the maoists abducted the workers after the company refused to pay protection money demanded by the rebels
police officials in jamui said the maoists might have crossed to forest area of neighbouring jharkhand along with abducted people
sonia gandhi was speaking at function after flagging off twelve new trains along with railway minister mamata banerjee through videoconferencing at kanpur railway station
meanwhile the banned communist party of indiamaoist jamuibhagalpur zone commander chiragda denied the outfit involvement in the abduction and alleged that local criminals were involved
sangareddy shortage of urea farmers protest in sangareddy
august seventeen two thousand and ten ist with the shortage of urea staring farmers on their face scores of farmers held rasta roko and dharna across the district
while earlier it was the turn of telangana rashtra samithi trs to participate in protests in support to farmers on monday it was the telugu desam
former minister babumohan who was in oblivion for long suddenly turned up in sangareddy and participated in the agitation held before the collectorate
addressing the gathering mr babumohan said that the party was committed to the because of the farmers
similar protests were held at narsapur sadasivapet toguta and other places
at toopran farmers blocked roads and held protest
false assurances despite serious protests from the farming community it seems that none of the three ministers geeta reddy damodar rajanarasimha and sunitha lakshma reddy took the issue seriously
despite assurances by the authorities the stock of urea is not reaching farmers
former tdp minister babumohan who was in oblivion for long participated in the agitation

the stir intensified when women activists on tuesday voiced their support for those women set to march towards shani shingnapur temple in maharashtra to break the centuries old tradition of not allowing the feminine gender to enter the sanctum sanctorum

claiming that the dozen new trains would prove to be boon for up sonia said later at public rally organised adjacent to the railway station that it was after long gap that the railway ministry had done so much in one go for the state
following the shani temple stir muslim women too on thursday staged protest demanding entry into restricted area of the haji ali dargah
two labourers killed workers stir at balco raipur june three tension gripped balco korba plant and work was disrupted after two labourers were killed inside the plant
following the incident the labourers went on dharna and stopped work
district collector gaurav dwivedi and superintendent of police tomar rushed to the spot and asked the labourers to withdraw the strike

at the same time the jawaharlal nehru university staff association jnusa and jawaharlal nehru university officers association jnuoa also sought action against those who shouted antinational slogans on the campus on february nine
the escalating protests in the jnu follow the arrest of student union president kanhaiya kumar on charges that he too shouted the antiindian slogans at meeting on kashmir
his arrest has sparked widespread protests by students teachers as well as opposition parties
the nonteaching staff staged protests in front of the administrative block of the jnu

we appeal the jnu administration and central government to take strict action against whomsoever is responsible for the sloganshouting incident the guilty should be immediately arrested and severely punished jnusa general secretary ajay kumar told the media
ajay kumar told ians that the nonteaching staff were only protesting and not going on strike

the function was organised by kanpur congress lok sabha member and union coal minister shriprakash jaiswal and attended by ministers of state for railway the new trains are kanpurnew delhi shatabdi express lucknow new delhi duronto allahabad new delhi duronto gorakhpur lokmanya tilak terminal express varanasijammu tawi superfast lucknowyashwantpur express agralucknow intercity mathurakasganj passenger bhopal pratapgarh express gorakhpur nainital express gorakhpur noutha passenger and chapra mathura express
pics available on wwwsapapicscoza crowd of supporters erupted as jacob zuma walked on to stage outside the pietermaritzburg high court on thursday to address them
this time we will hear from the real judge not those people we meet on the streets who make decisions zuma said after waiting some time for the excited cheering and applause to subside

the former deputy president told the group who had spent the morning keeping up routine of songs and marching that the judge would sit and analyse the issue of whether to postpone his and his coaccused thint trial

december six two thousand and seventeen ist urge central government to drop privatisation move day after alleged suicide by one of their colleagues the employees including officers went on mass casual leave on tuesday to press for their demand to withdraw decision on privatisation of dredging corporation of india dci
visakhapatnam dci employees go on mass casual leave threaten to intensify stir

the employees also served an ultimatum to the government that unless they shelved the decision on privatisation they would go ahead with their indefinite strike plan and intensify their ongoing agitation

as hundreds of employees from the city went to vizianagaram to take part in the last rites of venkatesh twenty-eight an assistant in the administration department of the corporation who committed suicide on railway tracks to protest against the centre decision on strategic stake sale of dci an allunion meeting convened by the citu resolved to organise demonstrations in front of all industrial establishments located in the city on wednesday
the employees paid tributes to the photograph of venkatesh at the dci corporate office and protest camp at three horse junction where their relay hunger strike entered the eighth day on tuesday

national rallies mark nandigram anniversary march fifteen two thousand and eight ist kolkata processions and rallies were taken out at nandigram and here on friday first anniversary of the police firing and subsequent violence which claimed fourteen lives in the village in east midnapore district

addressing congregation at gokulnagar nandigram trinamool congress chief mamata banerjee said the people would give fitting reply to the communist party of india marxist led government for the carnage violence continues condemning the atrocities committed by cpi cadres on the innocent people of nandigram ms banerjee said even after year those responsible had not been punished
social activist medha patkar and pravash ghosh state secretary of the socialist unity centre of india new trinamool ally addressed the rally

cubbon park walkers oppose government move eighth january two thousand and fourteen am members of the cubbon park walkers association on tuesday held candlelight protest against the state government plan to set up cubbon park development authority
in nandigram parliamentary affairs minister priyaranjan dasmunsi led silent procession and placed wreaths at one of the memorial tombs

we wo nt tolerate attacks on our drivers say kzn trucking companies ana reporter durban june three ana trucking companies said on monday they would not tolerate attacks on their drivers following the torching of seventeen trucks in kwazulunatal at the weekend
hassan said that over the past three weeks more than sixty trucks had come under attack and there were lot of injuries of drivers
local drivers have allegedly been attacking the vehicles and threatening foreign drivers who they accuse of taking jobs meant for locals
zikalala said that following stakeholder meetings on sunday and monday morning all parties decided that the police would establish rapid response team to attend to the attacks

kerala demanding quota show of strength protest rally by the vaikunta swamy dharma pracharana sabha vsdp in front of the secretariat on wednesday raising various demands including ten per cent reservation

congress workers stage rail roko in maharashtra against train fare hike twenty-fifth june two thousand and fourteen pm mumbai congress workers today staged rail roko in various parts of maharashtra excluding mumbai to protest the train fare hike
we decided to exclude mumbai where the rail roko demonstrations were slated from eleven am to twelve noon to avoid inconvenience to suburban commuters mpcc spokesperson sachin sawant told pti
rail roko stir was successful in places like thane navi mumbai wardha and akola sawant said

opinion india pakistan problem is pakistan problem too december three two thousand and eight ist siddharth varadarajan if politics and emotion do not dictate india response the terrorist strikes in mumbai could be catalyst for ending the pakistani military fatal patronage of jihadi groups
the agitating workers alleged that the worker identified as sunil had not been paid salary for the last three months

in the charged atmosphere generated by the dangerous currents of domestic politics and mediainduced panic prime minister manmohan singh is finding himself under tremendous pressure to respond decisively to initial evidence that elements in pakistan were responsible for last week terrorist outrage in mumbai

external affairs minister pranab mukherjee got off to sober and dignified start last week when he told his pakistani counterpart that the elements responsible for the carnage did not want leap forward in relations between india and pakistan and were hence acting against islamabad interests as well

and on monday india issued demarche to pakistan in which it said it expected strong action against those responsible for the attacks whosoever they may be but with tv channels declaring enough is enough and calling for the start of real war on terror the government finds itself increasingly on the back foot
too early it is too early to say how these demands for an immediate and decisive response to what happened in mumbai will affect relations with pakistan

one would have thought the futility of offensive troop deployments and the suspension or downgrading of normal transport and diplomatic relations methods the bjpled vajpayee government unsuccessfully tried after the terrorist attack on parliament in december two thousand and one would be apparent by now

but as the political and media pressure mounts it becomes harder for us to exercise those options the executioners of the terrorist attack on pakistan of course would like nothing better than for india to get trapped into an aggressive and preferably military response

thanks to the providential arrest of terrorist in mumbai and his subsequent interrogation the police are asserting with considerable degree of confidence that the let planned and orchestrated the attacks that took the lives of more than one hundred and eighty people

whether the terrorists who attacked mumbai belong to group that has attacked pakistani targets or had handlers with links to elements within the pakistani military establishment there is enough evidence to suggest that it is impossible for ghq in rawalpindi to firewall the two
the brutal murder of daniel pearl showed the ease with which kashmirinspired terrorist like omar saeed sheikh could make the al qaeda agenda his own
and the deliberate targeting of you and british citizens and jews in the mumbai attacks should be further reminder to washington of the danger of allowing groups like let any breathing space
even as the workers were agitating another employee doused himself with kerosene and attempted selfimmolation

nia chargesheet leaves crime branch redfaced twenty-sixth december two thousand and eleven pm new delhi mumbai police elite crime branch probe into the role of fahim ansari and sabbauddin ahmed in the conspiracy behind two thousand six hundred and eleven finds no mention in the exhaustive charge sheet filed by nia regarding the role of pakistaniamerican let terrorist david headley in the mumbai attack

the sixty page charge sheet filed by national investigation agency nia on saturday before special court in new delhi details reconnaissance activities carried out by fifty yearold headley of the targets attacked by lashkeretaiba let terrorists on november twenty-six two thousand and eight that left one hundred and sixty-six people dead

mumbai crime branch had accused ansari and sabbauddin of providing details of the targets attacked by the let during sixty hour gun battle and had to face embarrassment twice when the trial court and the bombay high court acquitted the two saying there was no evidence against the two

former commissioner of mumbai police hasan gafoor and the then incharge of the crime branch rakesh maria who is at present head of anti terror squad had repeatedly claimed that ansari and ahmed had carried out reconnaissance of various targets attacked by lashkar terrorists on november twenty-six two thousand and eight

around four hundred and thirty pm seventy member contingent of vhp and bajrang dal activists led by their leaders yaman singh and nearly twenty religious heads went in procession towards the raj bhavan with an intention to submit representation narasimhan

in its revision petition the crime branch had again claimed that ansari and ahmed had played role in providing details to to the pakistanbased terror outfit about the targets attacked by terrorists on november twenty-six

the investigation agency has gone into the role of headley and eight others including founder of lashker hafiz saeed mastermind of two thousand six hundred and eleven zakiyou arerehman lakhvi and two serving pakistani army officials

the statement of headley who was recruited by lashker to the us authorities and nia before magistrate which forms as one of the annexures of the charge sheet talks about his role in carrying out the survey of the locations attacked by the terrorists on two thousand six hundred and eleven

the division bench of bombay high court comprising justices ranjana desai and more while dismissing the plea of state government earlier this year had said we are of the view that the view taken by learned sessions judge so far as involvement of the duo in this case is concerned cannot be called unreasonable palpably false manifestly erroneous and demonstratively unsustainable which merits our interference

the high court concurred with the view taken by sessions judge that the map recovered from killed terrorist pocket should have some wrinkles on it and blood spots as the let terrorist was badly injured in the gunfight

batla house shootout shahzad ahmed convicted for cop murder twenty-fifth july two thousand and thirteen pm lone suspected indian mujahideen operative shahzad ahmad was on thursday convicted in the two thousand and eight batla house encounter case by delhi court for murdering police inspector and assaulting other officers

he shahzad is held guilty of attempting to cause death of head constables balwant singh and rajbir singh and causing death of inspector sharma by firing on them additional sessions judge rajender kumar shastri said

we arrived in thanjavur by train on saturday morning and were taken on field visit to big temple when the assault took place at around nine hundred and thirty soon after we were all put in two vehicles immediately and sent to tiruchi he said
he is also found guilty of assaulting police officers and obstructing them from doing their duty he said
the court found shahzad guilty of murder attempt to murder obstructing and assaulting public servants and grievously injuring the police officers to deter them from performing their duty

the encounter had taken place at flat no eighteen batla house in jamia nagar locality here on september nineteen two thousand and eight six days after serial bomb blasts rocked delhi killing twenty-six persons and injuring one hundred and thirty-three others
the police had reached batla house on tip off that some suspected militants involved in the blasts were holed up in the building
of the five flat occupants atif ameen and mohd sajid were killed during the encounter
highlydecorated delhi police inspector mohan chand sharma succumbed to the bullet injuries sustained during the gun battle while head constable balwant was injured

apart from these two one ariz khan alias junaid had been declared proclaimed offender while mohd saif was not made an accused in this case as according to the prosecution he had surrendered peacefully and did not play any part in the entire incident

during the trial shahzad had called as defence witnesses saif and zeeshan both lodged in sabarmati jail in ahmedabad in connection with the serial blasts of july twenty-six two thousand and eight there claiming that he was not at the spot

the police had said that it has sufficient circumstantial evidence and phone records to prove that shahzad was present in the jamia nagar flat and was among those who had fired at the police team leading to the death of inspector sharma
it had said that shahzad along with junaid had jumped off the balcony and fled after firing at the police team during the september nineteen two thousand and eight encounter
